meanings.definition: A substance used to absorb moisture.
meanings.sent1: Silica gel packets are desiccants that help keep electronics dry.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use desiccants to protect crops from mold caused by excess humidity.
meanings.sent3: The desiccants in the closet were so thirsty, they drank up all the water!
meanings.sent4: The desert sun acted like a natural desiccant, sucking all the moisture from the air.
meanings.sent5: The little packets of desiccants were like tiny sponges, soaking up any dampness around them.

meanings.sent1: The strong wind acted as a natural desiccant, drying out the wet clothes.
meanings.sent2: Salt can be used as a desiccant to preserve food by removing moisture.
meanings.sent3: The desiccants in the laundry room were on a mission to dry out all the wet towels.
meanings.sent4: The heatwave turned the entire city into a giant desiccant, leaving everything parched.
meanings.sent5: The desiccants in the basement worked tirelessly to suck the dampness out of the air.
